plural noun.description: The branch of science concerned with the nature and properties of matter and energy. The subject matter of physics, distinguished from that of chemistry and biology, includes mechanics, heat, light and other radiation, sound, electricity, magnetism, and the structure of atoms.

origin: Late 15th century (denoting natural science in general, especially the Aristotelian system): plural of obsolete physic physical (thing), suggested by Latin physica, Greek phusika natural things from phusis nature.
